intro: Pedilanthus macrocarpus, commonly known as the giant cupplant, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy inflorescences. The plant produces large, cup-shaped structures called cyathia, which contain small, yellowish flowers. Its leaves are typically alternate, simple, and have a rough texture. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
